resume_01_senior_ml_engineer.label: Good Match
resume_01_senior_ml_engineer.rationale: 7+ years ML experience, strong NLP/transformers expertise, PyTorch proficiency, AWS experience, published research, mentoring experience. Exceeds all requirements.

resume_02_data_scientist.label: Good Match
resume_02_data_scientist.rationale: 5 years experience meets requirement, strong Python/ML skills, NLP experience with transformers, AWS deployment experience. Strong candidate.

resume_03_software_engineer_ml.label: Partial Match
resume_03_software_engineer_ml.rationale: Strong software engineering background but only has ML through personal projects and courses. 4 years experience but not in ML. Potential to grow but needs training.

resume_04_junior_data_analyst.label: Partial Match
resume_04_junior_data_analyst.rationale: Only 2 years experience, primarily SQL/Excel analyst work. Currently learning ML but not yet proficient. Too junior for senior role but shows interest.

resume_05_backend_developer.label: Partial Match
resume_05_backend_developer.rationale: Strong engineering skills (6 years) and Python expertise, but no ML experience. Would need significant ML training. Good infrastructure skills for MLOps.

resume_06_project_manager.label: Poor Match
resume_06_project_manager.rationale: No technical ML skills. Role requires hands-on ML engineering, not project management. Wrong career track entirely.

resume_07_marketing_specialist.label: Poor Match
resume_07_marketing_specialist.rationale: Marketing background with no technical or ML experience. Completely misaligned with ML Engineer requirements.

resume_08_fresh_graduate.label: Partial Match
resume_08_fresh_graduate.rationale: Strong academic ML foundation, relevant projects with NLP/transformers, but 0 years of professional experience. Role requires 5+ years. Good for junior position.
